thread.title: GTA 5 update: Rockstar reveal everything Xbox 360 and PS3 will be missing online
thread.title_full: GTA 5 update: Rockstar reveal everything Xbox 360 and PS3 will be missing online

title: GTA 5 update: Rockstar reveal everything Xbox 360 and PS3 will be missing online
text:
GTA 5 update: Rockstar reveal everything Xbox 360 and PS3 will be missing online GTA 5 update: Rockstar reveal everything Xbox 360 and PS3 will be missing online ROCKSTAR unveiled its latest update for GTA 5's popular Online mode and it includes a huge list of new content set to bypass the Xbox 360 and PS3. PUBLISHED: 18:55, Thu, Oct 15, 2015 | UPDATED: 19:20, Thu, Oct 15, 2015 ROCKSTAR GTA 5's Lowrider update is skipping Xbox 360 and PS3 fans, Rockstar has confirmed 
Come October 20, Xbox One, PS4 and PC gamers will be able to visit Benny’s Original Motor Works, buy and customise new Lowriders models via their in-game phone and purchase a fourth property in Los Santos and Blaine County. 
Players will be able to make big modifications to the fleet of new vehicles, including decking out engine blocks with covers and air filters, coating interiors with velour, leather and patterns, while also getting to choose custom colours and designs for dials and new steering wheel and custom shift levers. 
It's a big change to GTA 5's usual setup and is the second update released from Rockstar that really gives some original new options. ROCKSTAR GTA 5 fans on Xbox One and PS4 can look forward to deeper car customisation 
Players can give these cars hydraulics, boost stereo performance with new speakers and subs and open up the vehicle doors, hood and trunk with their in-game phones. 
"Get stocked with the fully automatic Machine Pistol or Machete from Ammu-Nation," the announcement statement from Rockstar reads. 
"The upwardly mobile can also expand their garage space and fleet of vehicles with the addition of the oft-requested fourth purchasable property. 
"There’s also tons of new clothing, hair and accessory options as well as 3 new Adversary Modes and more." — Rockstar Games (@RockstarGames) October 15, 2015 
It sounds like a lot of fun and unfortunately, none of it is for Xbox 360 and PS3 players. 
Rockstar have warned in the past that hardware limitation would play a factor in when update would trail off for last-gen owners and it seems we have reached that point. 
If you look at both the Freemode Events introduced earlier this year and now the GTA Online Lowrider update , they are both on a different level, providing fresh new options that were probably not possible on the older platforms. Related articles GTA 5: Rockstar reveals update for Online domination on Xbox One,... 
Rockstar have yet to announce any consolation updates for Xbox 360 and PS3 users, although with Halloween around the corner, there could be some specially setup Weekend Events just for last-gen customers planned. 
A message covering the reasons behind Rockstar decisions, explains: "Future content updates such as this are only possible on the newer and more powerful systems. 
"As there isn’t enough memory available to add to the game on the older systems, we cannot make any more meaningful content updates without putting the entire game at risk." Most Read Stories in Gaming
